unnormalised: Automotive News Flash: Bangalore Traffic Gets a Festive Overhaul!
normalised: Automotive News Flash: Bangalore Traffic Gets a Festive Overhaul!

unnormalised: Heads up, Bengaluru drivers! With Onam around the corner, the Bangalore Traffic Police are cracking down on reckless driving. Expect increased checks near KR Puram and Silk Board.
normalised: Heads up, Bengaluru drivers! With Onam around the corner, the Bangalore Traffic Police are cracking down on reckless driving. Expect increased checks near K R Puram and Silk Board.

unnormalised: New regulations are in place focusing on drunk driving and speeding, especially after 10 PM. Fines for violating traffic rules have been hiked, with penalties now starting at Rs. 1000.
normalised: New regulations are in place focusing on drunk driving and speeding, especially after ten P M. Fines for violating traffic rules have been hiked, with penalties now starting at rupee one thousand.

unnormalised: Ramesh Uncle, who drives his auto near Majestic, says he's already seen more cops around. “Good, less drama on the roads, means more time for biryani!” he chuckled.
normalised: Ramesh Uncle, who drives his auto near Majestic, says he's already seen more cops around. “Good, less drama on the roads, means more time for biryani!” he chuckled.

unnormalised: The BTP is also piloting a new AI-powered system to identify traffic bottlenecks and dynamically adjust signal timings near MG Road. They claim this could reduce commute times by up to 15%.
normalised: The B T P is also piloting a new A I-powered system to identify traffic bottlenecks and dynamically adjust signal timings near M G Road. They claim this could reduce commute times by up to fifteen percent.

unnormalised: Remember to wear your helmets properly and stick to the speed limit (usually around 40 km/h in city areas). Let’s keep the roads safe and celebrate Onam responsibly! Drive safe, ya'll!
normalised: Remember to wear your helmets properly and stick to the speed limit (usually around forty kilometer per hour in city areas). Let’s keep the roads safe and celebrate Onam responsibly! Drive safe, ya'll!
